title: ollama/ollama
summary: Official Ollama repo: self-host LLMs (Llama 3, Mistral, Gemma…) with a single CLI or Docker container.

title: ollama-js
summary: Official JavaScript/TypeScript client for the Ollama HTTP API—works in Node & browsers.

title: ollama-python
summary: Official Python client for Ollama; chat, generate, embed, pull models with a few lines.

title: langchain-ollama
summary: LangChain adapter that turns any Ollama model into a drop-in LLM for chains & agents.

title: ollama-webui
summary: Feature-rich ChatGPT-style web UI for Ollama—drag-and-drop modelfiles, multi-user, RAG.

title: ollama4j
summary: Java/Kotlin client for Ollama with fluent builder API, streaming, and Android support.

title: ollama-rb
summary: Community Ruby gem for chatting and pulling models from a local Ollama instance.

title: ollama-cli
summary: Rust-based interactive CLI with syntax highlighting, conversation history, and themes.

title: ollama-copilot
summary: VS Code extension that brings local Ollama models into the editor as inline copilots.

title: ollama-helm
summary: Production-ready Helm chart for running Ollama on Kubernetes with GPU autoscaling.

title: ollama-docker-compose
summary: Official Docker Compose stack bundling Ollama server + CUDA runtime + optional WebUI.

title: ollama-haystack
summary: Haystack integration that lets you use Ollama models for QA, summarization, and RAG.

title: ollama-csharp
summary: .NET 8 client library with async enumerable streaming and dependency-injection helpers.

title: ollama-rag
summary: Minimal RAG example using Ollama embeddings + Chroma vector DB in 50 lines of Python.

title: ollama-discord-bot
summary: Self-hostable Discord bot that lets servers chat with any Ollama model via slash commands.

title: ollama-npm
summary: Official npm package for the Ollama JavaScript client—zero dependencies, ESM & CJS builds.

title: ollama-pypi
summary: Official PyPI package for the Ollama Python client—supports 3.8+ and async/await.

title: ollama-reddit
summary: Active subreddit for model recommendations, troubleshooting, and showcase projects.
